# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= word * " "
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word * " "
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
words = split("This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped to fit within a specific text width", " ")
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This code defines the `wrap_string` function which takes an array of words and wraps them into lines with a maximum length specified by `text_width`. The example usage demonstrates how to use the function.
